item.source: Custom Mod icons, not replacing but adding new ones

item.title: Custom Mod icons, not replacing but adding new ones
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:10, topic:195144”][quote author=xRedemptionx link=topic=259536.msg2153524#msg2153524 date=1207104624]
Could you have combinations? Like if your mod and donator, it loads the mod and donator sprite.
[/quote]
Of course.

Look at this section of code I’ve pulled out of my client:

                            if(byte0 == 2)
                            {
                                aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[1].method361(j1, i1 - 12);
                                j1 += 14;
                            }

And under it:

                            class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method385(0xff, s1 + ":", i1, 822, j1);
                            j1 += class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method383(anInt1116, s1) + 8;
                            class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method385(0xff0000, aStringArray944[k], i1, 822, j1);

Ok, you probably already know that method385 is for writing Strings with the specified color (first argument) in a chosen location (3rd and 5th arguments).
i1 is the y location of the start of the text, and j1 is the x location.

byte0, as shown in the first block of code, is a variable that represents the player’s rights (mod or admin).

If the player’s rights are 2, the crown will be displayed beside their name (using method361, the arguments are the x and y coordinates of the crown, respectively).
Then, the variable j1 is increased to shift the text over further so it doesn’t overlap with the crown.

If you wanted to display 2 crowns, you would simply display both crowns using the same arguments, increasing j1 by 14 after each.

If anyone’s curious why class30_2_1_1 is used for custom-made images instead of 2_1_2, the pixelgrabber arguments don’t agree with the data type used for the image’s width and height.[/quote]
they probably didnt know and still probably aren’t curious

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Mod icons, not replacing but adding new ones
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

xRedemptionx:

Could you have combinations? Like if your mod and donator, it loads the mod and donator sprite.

Of course.

Look at this section of code I’ve pulled out of my client:

                            if(byte0 == 2)
                            {
                                aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Array1219[1].method361(j1, i1 - 12);
                                j1 += 14;
                            }

And under it:

                            class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method385(0xff, s1 + ":", i1, 822, j1);
                            j1 += class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method383(anInt1116, s1) + 8;
                            class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method385(0xff0000, aStringArray944[k], i1, 822, j1);

Ok, you probably already know that method385 is for writing Strings with the specified color (first argument) in a chosen location (3rd and 5th arguments).
i1 is the y location of the start of the text, and j1 is the x location.

byte0, as shown in the first block of code, is a variable that represents the player’s rights (mod or admin).

If the player’s rights are 2, the crown will be displayed beside their name (using method361, the arguments are the x and y coordinates of the crown, respectively).
Then, the variable j1 is increased to shift the text over further so it doesn’t overlap with the crown.

If you wanted to display 2 crowns, you would simply display both crowns using the same arguments, increasing j1 by 14 after each.

If anyone’s curious why class30_2_1_1 is used for custom-made images instead of 2_1_2, the pixelgrabber arguments don’t agree with the data type used for the image’s width and height.

I almost forgot something.

[quote=“xxxMeanzxxxx, post:1, topic:195144”]Yes i’ve done this aint that hard though
[/quote]

Go to the development/help section if you want to brag.

Read full topic
